greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Row sums of A072030.
comment: Let A(x) = sum {n >= 1} x^n/(1 - x^n) be the Lambert series generating function of the divisor function tau(n) - see A000005. Then it appears that A(x)^2 is equal to the Lambert series sum {n >= 2} a(n-1)*x^n/(1 - x^n) (checked up to x^1000 using Luschny's formula for a(n)).

This conjecture is equivalent to the following identity for the divisor function: for n >= 2 there holds sum {k = 1..n} tau(k)*tau(n-k) = sum {d divides n} ( sum {k = 1..d} tau(k*(d - k)) ), where we take tau(0) = 0. (End)
link: James C. Alexander, The Entropy of the Fibonacci Code (1989).
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := T[n, k] = Which[n < 1 || k < 1, 0, n == k, 1, n < k, T[k, n], True, 1 + T[k, n - k]];
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 07 2002
